title: Alcaraz rallies in French thriller: 'Just believed'
description: Carlos Alcaraz came back from two sets down and saved three match points to beat Jannik Sinner on Sunday and retain the French Open title.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Sources: RB Chubb expected to sign with Texans
description: Four-time Pro Bowl running back Nick Chubb is expected to sign a one-year deal with the Texans on Monday, sources told ESPN.
author: DJ Bien-Aime

title: Sinner and Alcaraz thriller proves rivalry here to stay
description: A first major final between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner always promised to deliver - but few expected it to reach the heights that it did.

title: Ronaldo tears & Yamal's nemesis - has Nations League saved Martinez?
description: Cristiano Ronaldo is in tears as he wins a third trophy with Portugal - could the Nations League save his manager Roberto Martinez's job?

title: 'One of the greatest matches' - Alcaraz beats Sinner in epic French Open final
description: Carlos Alcaraz saved three championship points before retaining the French Open title by defeating world No 1 Jannik Sinner 4-6 6-7 (4-7) 6-4 7-6 (7-3) 7-6 (10-2) in one of the greatest-ever Grand Slam finals.

title: Keane slams England attitude vs Andorra as Tuchel says: 'We played with fire'
description: Roy Keane criticised the attitude of England's players in their laboured 1-0 World Cup qualifying win over Andorra, as Three Lions boss Thomas Tuchel admitted: "We played with fire".

title: OU football adds edge rusher Matthew Nelson to Sooners' 2026 recruiting class
description: OU football welcomed a plethora of visitors during its massive official visit weekend and is already reaping the benefits.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo sheds tears of joy after Portugal's Nations League triumph
description: The Portugal star shed tears after helping his team win the Nations League on Sunday. Ronaldo scored to help Portugal draw level with Spain 2-2 in the final, then watched as his teammates won the penalty shootout 5-3. “I have many titles with my clubs, but nothing is better than winning for Portugal,” Ronaldo said.
author: CIARÁN FAHEY
